heading: Who receives the most migrants?
subheading: In 2022, there were an estimated 11 non-EU immigrants per 1 000 EU inhabitants, with Malta having the highest rate (66 immigrants per 1 000 inhabitants) and Slovakia having the lowest rate (1 immigrant per 1 000 inhabitants).
textNote: Bulgaria, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Finland, Sweden and Liechtenstein did not include refugees from Ukraine who benefit from temporary protection in their population and migration statistics.
